name: places/ChIJfQdsvJxYwokRp6rEVp0mLbg
formattedAddress: 609 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 609 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024-1408, USA

originalText.text: So grateful that this place is so close! We've been customers for over two years. We're a family of four and have not lost any clothing - not a single item and we use them A LOT. Nothing has come back damaged either. Very very rarely we might find a spot on a tee shirt but it is from fabric softener, so it comes right out. This is a super rare thing but I wanted to give others a heads up that if you do see a spot, it is only fabric softener - again though - extremely rare. Depending on your timing you can get wash & fold back on same day. The folding is perfectly compact. They are a HUGE time saver. I've personally only had friendly service from them.

originalText.text: Pretty consistently good! Love that I can sometimes get my wash & fold back same day, and that I don't have to schedule a time for them to deliver it. No lost or damaged items so far in the 6 months I've been using them so far. ü§ûüèºüëçüèæ

originalText.text: Used this business for 3 years but a large dry cleaning order was lost. They claimed to have delivered it but my doormen said otherwise. Never got the clothes. EFI not only refused to reimburse me for the clothes but still charged me $150 for the order. They clearly don‚Äôt care enough about customers to keep our business.

originalText.text: Inexpensive, effective, and friendly. Only reason I'm giving four stars is because they didn't fold the socks together.

text.text: Inexpensive, effective, and friendly. Only reason I'm giving four stars is because they didn't fold the socks together.

originalText.text:
Absolutely hate this place. I had to dry clean a lot of comforters and pillows, I  just had a stem cell transplant, so last thing I needed around me was mold. All of my comforters came back smelling damp and my pillows had mold on them. Lost well over $1000. The woman blamed me for taking a month to pick them up, which makes zero sense.

Now I only go to 90th and Amsterdam, where they do a great job and take accountability.
